CONJUGATES: promise (base form) | promises (3rd person singular present) | promised (past tense, past participle) | promising (present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From the verb 'promise', from Old French promesse, from Latin promissa, feminine past participle of promittere 'send forth, promise' (from pro- 'forth' + mittere 'send')

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Showing signs of future success or excellence; likely to turn out well.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 显示出未来成功或卓越的迹象；很可能发展顺利。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The young athlete showed promising talent from an early age.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位年轻的运动员从小就展现出有前途的才华。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Making a solemn vow or assurance; giving a promise.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 做出庄严的誓言或保证；许诺。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was promising his full support to the community during the election.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在选举期间，他向社区承诺全力支持。
